thread.section_title: Wilson Amplifiers Reviews | Customer Service Reviews of Wilson Amplifiers | wilsonamplifiers.com | 2 of 64
thread.title: Rick

author: Rick
title: Rick
text:
I'm delighted with the Wilson Pro 70. We recently bought a house in a
rural-ish area. We experienced solid 2 bars (~-105-110db) outside the
house and sketchy 1-2 bars inside before installing. After installation
we now get solid 4 bars (~-75-90db) inside the house! Outstanding!!!
I installed the yagi directional antenna inside the attic at the peak of
the roof pointing out a wood vent towards the nearest tower and located the 'inside' antenna about 40 feet horizontal, 6 feet vertical away pointing slightly down towards living area and bedrooms. Directly in the line of this antenna we now see 4-5 bars and even at the most distant corner of the house get 3-4 bars. Woooohoooo!
This was a bit expensive but works as advertised and as it'll be used
daily will be worth the investment. I could probably get solid 5 bars
all the time if I put the yagi on an antenna pole 10-20 feet higher than
the roof (lots of tall pine trees between us and the nearest tower) as
well as putting the inside antenna inside but the current configuration
works great and it saved me from fiddling with a mast on the roof and
from fishing wire down through the ceiling.
